abilities.description: Resets the cooldowns of all your items and abilities. Shares a cooldown with Refresher Orb. This item's cooldown only progresses in your hero's main inventory.

additionalInformation: On his third death and onwards, Roshan drops the Refresher Shard as a third item if he was slain in the Dire pit. In the Radiant pit, he drops an Aghanim's Blessing - Roshan instead.
Although Refresher Shard cannot be bought, it can be sold for 500 . However, only the hero whose main inventory it enters first can sell it.
If a Courier is the first unit to pick up the Refresher Shard, it cannot be sold by anyone, even if it remains on the Courier or is given to a hero afterwards.
If a Refresher Shard directly enters a backpack when picked up, it remains sellable by anyone until it enters any unit's main inventory.
Unlike the Aegis of the Immortal, Refresher Shard is not reclaimed by Roshan.
name: Refresher Shard
description: Across an epoch of endless battle, the Immortal's will to triumph never faltered.
trivia: The Refresher Shard's icon and in-game model are based on Refresher Orb. Its active uses the same sound and visual effect as Refresher Orb.
The pop-up that appears when you hover over the item on the ground shows a buying price of 1000 , but when you pick it up, the pop-up shows the selling price of 500 .
When selecting Roshan, this item can be seen in his inventory.
tips: The Refresher Shard is basically a Refresher Orb with a single charge, so the same tips apply to it.

However, due to it having no gold cost, it opens a lot of possibilities for heroes who normally don't or can't buy a Refresher Orb, either due to being unable to farm it up, or it being too ineffective for the item slot.
In some scenarios, it might be worth it to sell the Refresher Shard for its selling price of gold to buy a key item sooner rather than consuming it.
